com.quorum.tessera.enclave

Interface Enclave

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Service
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EnclaveClient
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EnclaveImpl

    public interface Enclave
extends Service
    An Enclave provides encryption/decryption functions and keeps hold of all the nodes private keys so the do not leak into other services.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.quorum.tessera.service.Service

        Service.Status

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] createNewRecipientBox(EncodedPayload payload, PublicKey recipientKey)
      Creates a new recipient box for the payload, for which we must be the originator.
      PublicKey defaultPublicKey()
      Retrieves the public key to use if no key is specified for an operation There is no guarantee this key remains the same between runs of the Enclave.
      EncodedPayload encryptPayload(byte[] message, PublicKey senderPublicKey, List<PublicKey> recipientPublicKeys)
      Encrypts a message using the specified sender and a list of recipients.
      EncodedPayload encryptPayload(RawTransaction rawTransaction, List<PublicKey> recipientPublicKeys)
      Decrypts a RawTransaction so that it can be re-encrypted into a EncodedPayload with the given recipient list
      RawTransaction encryptRawPayload(byte[] message, PublicKey sender)
      Encrypt a payload without any recipients that can be retrieved later.
      Set<PublicKey> getForwardingKeys()
      Returns a set of public keys that should be included as recipients to all transactions produced by this node.
      Set<PublicKey> getPublicKeys()
      Returns all the public keys that are managed by this Enclave.
      default void start() 
      default void stop() 
      byte[] unencryptTransaction(EncodedPayload payload, PublicKey providedKey)
      Decrypt a transaction and fetch the original message using the given public key.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.quorum.tessera.service.Service

        status

    • Method Detail

      • defaultPublicKey

        PublicKey defaultPublicKey()
        Retrieves the public key to use if no key is specified for an operation There is no guarantee this key remains the same between runs of the Enclave.
        Returns:
        the public key that has been assigned as the default

      • getForwardingKeys

        Set<PublicKey> getForwardingKeys()
        Returns a set of public keys that should be included as recipients to all transactions produced by this node. The keys are not be managed by this node.
        Returns:
        the set of public keys to be added to transactions

      • getPublicKeys

        Set<PublicKey> getPublicKeys()
        Returns all the public keys that are managed by this Enclave.
        Returns:
        all public keys managed by this Enclave

      • encryptPayload

        EncodedPayload encryptPayload(byte[] message,
                              PublicKey senderPublicKey,
                              List<PublicKey> recipientPublicKeys)
        Encrypts a message using the specified sender and a list of recipients. Returns a EncodedPayload which contains all the encrypted information, including the recipients and their encrypted master keys.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be encrypted
        senderPublicKey - the public key which this enclave manages
        recipientPublicKeys - the recipients to encrypt this message for
        Returns:
        the encrypted information, represented by an EncodedPayload

      • encryptPayload

        EncodedPayload encryptPayload(RawTransaction rawTransaction,
                              List<PublicKey> recipientPublicKeys)
        Decrypts a RawTransaction so that it can be re-encrypted into a EncodedPayload with the given recipient list
        Parameters:
        rawTransaction - the transactiopn to decrypt and re-encrypt with recipients
        recipientPublicKeys - the recipients to encrypt the transaction for
        Returns:
        the encrypted information, represented by an EncodedPayload

      • encryptRawPayload

        RawTransaction encryptRawPayload(byte[] message,
                                 PublicKey sender)
        Encrypt a payload without any recipients that can be retrieved later. The payload is encrypted using the private key that is related to the given public key.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be encrypted
        sender - the sender's public key to encrypt the transaction with
        Returns:
        the encrypted transaction

      • unencryptTransaction

        byte[] unencryptTransaction(EncodedPayload payload,
                            PublicKey providedKey)
        Decrypt a transaction and fetch the original message using the given public key. Throws an NaclException if the provided public key OR one of the Enclave's managed keys cannot be used to decrypt the payload
        Parameters:
        payload - the encrypted payload
        providedKey - the key to use for decryption, if the payload wasn't sent by this Enclave
        Returns:
        the original, decrypted message

      • createNewRecipientBox

        byte[] createNewRecipientBox(EncodedPayload payload,
                             PublicKey recipientKey)
        Creates a new recipient box for the payload, for which we must be the originator. At least one recipient must already be available to be able to decrypt the master key.
        Parameters:
        payload - the payload to add a recipient to
        recipientKey - the new recipient key to add

      • start

        default void start()
        Specified by:
        start in interface Service

      • stop

        default void stop()
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Service
